apiDescription: A range only bounded exclusively above (..end).
The RangeTo ..end contains all values with x < end. It cannot serve as an Iterator because it doesn't have a starting point.
examples:
It does not have an IntoIterator implementation, so you can't use it in
a for loop directly. This won't compile:
â“˜This example deliberately fails to compile

When used as a slicing index, RangeTo produces a slice of all array
elements before the index indicated by end.

trait implementations.name: impl<Idx> std::hash::Hash for std::ops::RangeTo<Idx> where Idx: std::hash::Hash
impl<Idx> std::clone::Clone for std::ops::RangeTo<Idx> where Idx: std::clone::Clone
impl<Idx> std::fmt::Debug for std::ops::RangeTo<Idx> where Idx: std::fmt::Debug
impl<Idx> std::cmp::Eq for std::ops::RangeTo<Idx> where Idx: std::cmp::Eq
impl<Idx> std::cmp::PartialEq<std::ops::RangeTo<Idx>> for std::ops::RangeTo<Idx> where Idx: std::cmp::PartialEq<Idx>
impl<Idx> std::marker::Copy for std::ops::RangeTo<Idx> where Idx: std::marker::Copy
impl<'a, T> std::ops::RangeBounds<T> for std::ops::RangeTo<&'a T>
impl<Idx> std::marker::Send for std::ops::RangeTo<Idx> where Idx: std::marker::Send
impl<Idx> std::marker::Sync for std::ops::RangeTo<Idx> where Idx: std::marker::Sync

methods.name: pub fn contains<U>(&self, item: &U) -> bool where Idx: PartialOrd<U>, U: PartialOrd<Idx> + ?Sized
